title: Todd Iodice, CFA
text: Quantitative finance professional and data scientist with over five years of experience at T. Rowe Price, where I’ve led portfolio implementation for ETFs and multi-asset strategies, built internal APIs and analytical tools, and spearheaded quantitative research initiatives. I hold a CFA charter, a BS in Economics and BA in Mathematics from Duke University (Magna Cum Laude), and an MS in Computer Science from Johns Hopkins University with a focus on Data Science and Cloud Computing.

title: Todd Iodice, CFA
text:
Experience

T. Rowe Price — Baltimore, MD
Lead Portfolio Investment Analyst, Associate Vice President | June 2021 – Present

Led portfolio implementation for ETFs and multi-asset strategies, managing day-to-day operations of some of the firm’s most complex accounts, including an internal hedge fund and volatility-based strategies.
Modeled across equities, fixed income, ABS, swaps, and options with near-zero error tolerance in a fast-paced trading environment.
Researched implementation considerations for new and existing strategies, resulting in improved capital efficiency, reduced transaction costs, narrower tracking error, and more efficient workflows.
Developed the Target Weight Service API to generate account models and internal benchmarks, enabling scalable implementation of complex account requirements from portfolio managers and clients.
Headed the Global Trading Innovations team, enabling members of the Global Trading division with quantitative and technical skills to collaborate, share best practices, and develop high-quality tools.
Ran (and won) a division-wide hackathon that spurred 7 impactful ideas to fruition.
Coded tools to automate workflows and improve accuracy, resulting in a significant reduction in error incidents and enabling 3 new strategies and dozens of new accounts without additional headcount.
Directed requirements, prioritization, and testing for Technology teams to transition off legacy systems, build data services, and provide infrastructure for business-developed APIs.
Managed 1 summer intern, mentored 2 junior associates, and trained 4 new team members.

Investment Fellow | June 2019 – May 2021

Rotated through 4 of the firm’s quantitative research teams across Equity, Fixed Income, and Multi-Asset.
Researched macroeconomic factors and developed global regime models, improving Multi-Asset Steering Committee decisions on asset allocation for Target Date Funds.
Developed quantitative investment signals using alternative data sources — including employment reviews and credit card transactions — to identify opportunities for the firm’s quantitative equity strategies.
Created data tools and performed ad-hoc analyses to support the fundamental equity research platform.
